title: Novo Nordisk to support MIT postdocs working at the intersection of AI and life sciences
summary: MIT's School of Engineering and Novo Nordisk, a global healthcare company, have partnered to launch the MIT-Novo Nordisk Artificial Intelligence Postdoctoral Fellows Program. The program aims to support postdoctoral fellows conducting research at the intersection of artificial intelligence (AI) and data science with life sciences. The program will provide up to $10 million annually to support a cohort of up to 10 postdocs for two-year terms. The fellows will participate in events and gatherings to exchange ideas and discuss ways to amplify their impact. They will also receive professional development opportunities and mentorship from experts in life sciences and data science. The program aims to advance the use of AI in healthcare and improve the lives of people with chronic diseases.
